meanings.definition: To make a shrill, wailing sound
meanings.sent1: The wind skirled through the trees, creating an eerie sound.
meanings.sent2: She skirled in terror when she saw the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent3: The teapot skirled loudly as it reached boiling point, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The ambulance siren skirled through the night, alerting everyone to an emergency.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's scream skirled through the quiet library, causing heads to turn in concern.

meanings.sent1: The skirled of the fire alarm echoed through the building, signaling an evacuation.
meanings.sent2: The skirled of the violin filled the concert hall with its haunting melody.
meanings.sent3: The skirled of the tea kettle made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The skirled of the whistle marked the end of the game, leaving the players exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The skirled of the seagulls overhead added to the peacefulness of the beach.
